title: 1.02 JURISDICTION OVER WATERS.
text: Courts and officers having jurisdiction in a county bordering upon Big Stone Lake, Lake Traverse, Bois de Sioux River, or the Red River of the North, have jurisdiction in civil and criminal cases upon those waters concurrently with the courts and officers of other states bordering on them, to the extent any of them forms a common boundary between this state and any other state.

variables.name: county
variables.description: The county where the court or officer has jurisdiction.

variables.name: water_body
variables.description: The body of water in question.

variables.name: forms_common_boundary
variables.description: Indicates if the water body forms a common boundary with another state.

variables.name: bordering_counties
variables.description: List of counties bordering the specified water bodies.

variables.name: bordering_waters
variables.description: List of water bodies that form a common boundary with another state.

consequences: The court or officer has jurisdiction in civil and criminal cases on the specified waters.
